utterance.speaker: EDDIE RAMIREZ
utterance.content: Good night and sleepy dreams. Ah, no. Good night and sweet dreams.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: D'Artagnan, how you got out of cage, huh?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Stop it! Stop it! Stop!

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … who are you yelling at?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No one. I just … still have writer’s block, that’s all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you’re taking it out on your laptop?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, not the laptop. The - that cursor. I mean, just look at it there. Taunting me. It’s just blinking – on, off, on, off. Like it’s so easy writing a best-selling novel. Because I’d like you see you try it, Mr. Cursor. I’d like you see you try! Why don’t –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why don’t we just … say goodbye to Mr. Cursor? What is this, fan mail?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, not exactly. Remember when I went on Good Morning America awhile back and offered a reward for proof of anyone who knew what happened to me during those eight weeks I disappeared?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But Castle, those letters are over a year old. And we’ve already proven that all the theories were ridiculous. Why are you rereading them?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To spark my imagination. But honestly, these letters are not very inventive. They all claim I was a victim of a government conspiracy or abducted by aliens and probed. This guy even drew a diagram of me violated by ET.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I need inspiration, Beckett. And although Lester’s knowledge of alien anatomy is commendable, it’s just not enough.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just a second … Beckett. Okay. All right, I will be right there. You know I would love to take you, but –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But we have to maintain the ruse of our separation until you capture LokSat. I know, I know. But what am I supposed to write about without my muse, Beckett? I need you! I – I’m Sherlock without Watson.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, you probably mean Watson without your Sherlock because after all, my darling – – you’re the writer. Okay. I’ll see you. Ah, you know what? Why don’t you just go to your PI office if you’re so desperate for a case to solve. Maybe Alexis and Hayley have something that’s worthy of inspiration?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good morning, Ryan.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I saw the broken door outside. Robbery gone wrong?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nope. We don’t think so. According to the zoo supervisor all the animals are accounted for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that a snake hook?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep. Looks like our victim was bludgeoned to death with it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Who’s the victim?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, we’re not a hundred percent sure yet.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The zoo supervisor thinks that it’s Eddie Ramirez, the nighttime animal caretaker. If it is, then he’s an El Salvador native who’s lived in the States for the past three years –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, can we go back? Why are you having trouble IDing the victim?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We can’t positively ID the victim yet because the killer tossed his body into –

utterance.speaker: ME SIDNEY PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: A pit filled with deadly snakes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well … that’s a first.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your fearless leader has arrived.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yay. Now go file these.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I take it business has been good?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY SHIPTON
utterance.content: We’re working on three cases right now: a corporate maleficence, an insurance fraud, and a financial embezzlement.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. You know what all three of those cases have in common? They’re all incredibly boring. Come on, you guys! When did you sell out?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I think what you meant to say, Rick, was thank you so much, ladies, for taking my money pit of a hobby and making it into a profitable business.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn’t open this place to make money. I opened it for the exciting cases. You know, the double-crossing dame, the stolen relic, a locked room mystery.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, you’re just naming plots from 1940s gumshoe novels. Speaking of, aren’t you supposed to be writing your next Nikki Heat book?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I would if I could. Come on, guys, let’s just ditch this corporate nonsense and find a case worthy of investigating. You know, with mysteries, with bold characters, and twists and turns – – and murdered man ends up in pit of deadly snakes? Now that – that is a case worth investigating!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Well hello, Captain. I’m glad you’re alone. I’ve been meaning to say how proud I am of you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. For what?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: For breaking up with Mr. Castle, of course. Now you’re free to meet a man who can really appreciate you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um –

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Like my brother, Edgar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your brother?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: My identical twin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, there’s two of you?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I’d be happy to introduce you –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, no! Uh, no. But uh … thank you, Perlmutter. It’s just that I’m not quite ready to date right now. But I understand you have confirmed that our victim is Eddie Ramirez, right?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Yes. Here are his personal affects. Cause of death was blunt force trauma to the skull.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Based on lividity I’d say it took place between 9 and 11 last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then the killer must have dumped his body in the snake pit to slow down our investigation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Genius plan.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, what the hell are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s nice to see you too, Perlmutter.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Can’t you see the lady doesn’t love you anymore? Be a man. Walk away. See, it’s because of nitwit pretty boys like you that good men like my brother, Edgar, struggle to find –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Perlmutter! Would you mind giving us the room for just a minute?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: There’s a scalpel and a rib spreader if you need them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. Perlmutter really doesn’t like me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Neither do I right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know, I know! I just wanted to see the snakes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Help yourself, Castle. They are all at the zoo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? They’re not here? I thought they would be evidence or something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, but this might be. Someone sent the victim a text yesterday. “Where go my money Eddie. Yous owe huge. Paybacks time. I got ways for to get you dead…”. I was sent by a blocked number. I’ll see if Vikram can trace it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “I got ways for to get you dead.” That’s a particular syntax, a unique grammatical structure, perhaps denoting a cultural significance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe bad autocorrect?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, Beckett, this was no error. This was a specific choice. It was a methodical decision. Dialectology 101. And I, being an expert in the English language, would be happy to help you solve this linguistic mystery.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you’re not going to work the case. So why don’t you just go back home and I will see you tonight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: While I do love kissing you, Beckett, it’s just a little creepy when you do it in front of a dead body. It’s … inappropriate.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Cap, check out what we found hidden under Eddie Ramirez’s bed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ten Gs. Question is, how does someone who feeds snakes and lizards for a living scrape together this much cash?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now that threatening text that Eddie received was about owing someone money. I’d be shocked if those two aren’t related.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM SINGH
utterance.content: If they are then I might be of assistance. Turns out, the text was sent from an untraceable burner but when the text was sent it had to go through a wireless network.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did you track down the network?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Yep. It belongs to an English as a Second Language school.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is there any connection to Eddie Ramirez?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I spoke with the teacher who said Eddie was a part of the class but he was absent yesterday when the text was sent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, guys. Go check it out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: The students in the class repeat en mass after the teacher
utterance.content: “to get to JKF airport from here you can take the E train”.

utterance.speaker: JOHN EMERSON
utterance.content: But since you are late for your flight I suggest you take a cab.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. We’re NYPD.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: Hearing about Eddie was quite a shock. The students have been talking about it all morning.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We understand Eddie missed class yesterday. Do you know if he was avoiding any of the other students? Perhaps someone he was having problems with?

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: Eddie? Nah. He was a sweet man and gentle soul. Everybody liked him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, not everybody. This text was sent yesterday during class. Any idea who might have written that?

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: “Where go my money Eddie. Yous owe huge. Paybacks time.” I don’t know. It’s hard to say. All my students are still learning English.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well then, we’re going to need to talk to all your students one by one.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: Oh, that’s going to be harder than you think, Detective. Most of my students come from countries where the cops are corrupt, so they’re not going to want to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Look, teach, we don’t tell you how to conjugate a verb, don’t tell us how to interview a suspect.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, we’re going to get them to talk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you couldn’t get any of them to talk?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Javi did get a contact number for Eddie’s next of kin in El Salvador.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s true, but there was no one home so I had to leave a message.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ugh.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Captain, we can drag each one of the students down into interrogation, sweat the truth out of them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no. If they’re already afraid of cops it’s only going to alienate them further. But there might be another way to do this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you have in mind?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, don’t worry about it. Why don’t you guys dig into those student’s lives. Clearly one of them is hiding their true feelings about Eddie.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing. Just reading a book.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, do you really think you can figure out who sent that text based on linguistics?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I can do that. All I have to do is hear them speak and I can match the syntax. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well you may be able to work this case after all. At least, in an undercover capacity.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bonjour everyone. Je m’appelle Jean Luc de la Croix.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: Hello, Jean Luc. Welcome to our English as a Second Language class.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you very much, Monsieur.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: That accent is fascinating. Where are you joining us from?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, Jolicour, Quebec.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: Oh, French Canadian. Wonderful, wonderful. And what do you do there for a living?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I … am uh, how you say, a chef.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: A chef!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oui.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: Marvelous! We’re having our international food celebration tonight. Cannot wait to sample some of your authentic French cuisine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oui, me too.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: Well, class, it’s time for us to break out into our small talk discussions. Why don’t we get up and circulate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll just –

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: Please. Please.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello, I am Jean Luc. Nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: KIM HYUN JOO
utterance.content: Hi, I am Kim Hyun Joo from Korea.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is it? Please, don’t be shy. Tell me more about yourself. Anything? Uh, okay. All right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good. Okay. Very nice to … meet you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Enchanté. I am Jean Luc. So, what brings you to America?

utterance.speaker: AIDA
utterance.content: Je suis venu New York –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you are speaking French like back in Senegal. Oh, be we are supposed to be speaking English, no?

utterance.speaker: AIDA
utterance.content: I have come to America because it is my dream to become a successful painter someday.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, very good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, oui, oui.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello, I am Jean Luc.

utterance.speaker: ACHMED
utterance.content: Hi, I am Achmed. I urinate now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Hello, I am Jean Luc.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excuse me, Monsieur, perhaps it would help me to, how you say, catch up with the rest of the class if I was able to look at their assignments.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: You’ll be fine, Jean Luc. In fact, your English is already quite good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, excuse me. One of the other students would like your attention. In the back. Keep looking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I figured out who send the text. Guy’s name is Alistair Gascoyne.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure it’s him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. The grammatical structure in the text – “I got ways for to make you dead” – is a direct match to his homework assignment where he wrote “I went for to get some beer”.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good job, Castle. I’ll have Ryan and Espo take it from here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you going to tell them about my involvement?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I have to. I mean, I’ll say that you found out about the ESL class on your own and that I had no idea that you were going undercover.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think they’ll buy it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. I mean, when have you ever gone against my wishes and interfered with an investigation?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No need for sarcasm, all you had to say was yes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So we just got off the phone with the Metropolitan Police Service in London. They sure did have a lot to say about you, Alistair.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Multiple arrests for assault and battery. Said that you were an enforcer for a loan shark named Jimmy “the Bones” Barrett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did you move to America and go into business for yourself, Alistair? Did Eddie owe you money, is that why you killed him?

utterance.speaker: ALISTAIR
utterance.content: Other way, man. Don’t shoot your gob off. I wasn’t even dunce tepache. I was mottle in the boozer when Eddie went down like.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If this guy is from England why doesn’t he speak English?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. But I think I know just the person to ask.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: He’s a Geordie. From Newcastle. Though technically English, the language has evolved to include a certain unique vocabulary and grammatical structure. I can translate.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You threatened to kill Eddie.

utterance.speaker: ALISTAIR
utterance.content: I sent the gadger the message. Maybe since I get improper ragey like.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, he says that he only sent Eddie the text message because he was furious.

utterance.speaker: ALISTAIR
utterance.content: Eddie asked us for the borrow gypsy motor buggy night. Two nights ago it was.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: He drives a gypsy cab and Eddie asked to borrow it two nights ago.

utterance.speaker: ALISTAIR
utterance.content: I right done. When the gadger done give it to us back it was right hackey with bullets mine.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh goodness.

utterance.speaker: ALISTAIR
utterance.content: Some river shot my buggy!

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: So when Alistair got the gypsy cab back the next morning it was riddled with bullet holes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So someone shot up your cab.

utterance.speaker: ALISTAIR
utterance.content: Aye. Got me right ragey like. Eddie tells us, he meant to give us proper cultural to fettle it. The doylan never arrived.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: That’s why he was so livid. Eddie promised that he would pay for the damage and then he didn’t show up for class.

utterance.speaker: ALISTAIR
utterance.content: I thought Eddie gone to ground. So I festered out low like. But Eddie didn’t even mean it, man.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: He thought that Eddie was trying to dodge him and so that’s why he sent him the threatening message. But he swears he didn’t mean it. He’s just … really pissed off.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Um … let’s assume that Alistair’s telling the truth. Do you know where he took your cab? Do you know if he was meeting someone?

utterance.speaker: ALISTAIR
utterance.content: Uh uh.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Uh uh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So tell us about your gypsy cab. Does it have GPS?

utterance.speaker: ALISTAIR
utterance.content: Aye.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well Alistair alibied out. He was blind drunk at a pub during our time of death window.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about his gypsy cab?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like Alistair was telling the truth. Wherever Eddie drove that cab someone tried to kill him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow, sounds like our mild mannered zoo worker rattled a few cages.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Actually, Eddie wasn’t so mild mannered after all. I got in touch with his next of kin in El Salvador. Eddie used to be a cop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait. He was a cop? Why are we just hearing about this now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He lied on his immigration forms.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why wouldn’t Eddie want people to know he’s a former police officer?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I thought that was strange, too, so I did a little digging. Apparently there were rumors that Eddie was part of a corrupt police unit. These guys were accused of extorting criminals, taking bribes.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Hey. So I’ve gone through the GPS in Alistair’s gypsy cab. Looks like Eddie only made one stop. A place called the Saldana Club.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, what do we know about this place?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: It’s run by Jose and Frankie Saldana, a couple of low level players, but they’ve got priors of assault and trafficking. Plus, word is they deal drugs out of their club.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well if Eddie used to shake down crooks in El Salvador maybe he was doing the same thing to these guys here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And they might have killed him for it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Jose and Frankie Saldana?

utterance.speaker: JOSE SALDANA
utterance.content: Yeah, who’s asking?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So what happened? Someone drop a grenade in here?

utterance.speaker: JOSE
utterance.content: We’re redecorating. You like?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like you boys got into a little trouble.

utterance.speaker: JOSE
utterance.content: Yeah. Rock climbing accident.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: JOSE
utterance.content: See, Frankie here forgot how to tie one of those fancy knots. Oopsie.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So it’s got nothing to do with Eddie Ramirez? The guy you took a shot at?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sorry, I have to get water.

utterance.speaker: JOSE
utterance.content: Eddie Ramirez? Never heard of him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Really? Because if a short, fifty year old man broke my face and stole ten grand I’d remember. Let me jog your memory. Eddie –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Something on your mind?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: They’re lying their asses off. That man, Eddie Ramirez? He was here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Came in all calm. Next thing I know he’s beating the crap out of Jose and Frankie. Forcing them to fill up a briefcase with cash.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you saw that all happen?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Oh yeah. As Eddie was walking out Frankie grabbed a gun from under the bar, hobbled out, shot up the guy’s car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, then what about last night? Did they go after Eddie? Try to get their revenge?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: They couldn’t have. They were both laid up in the hospital. Just got released this morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would Eddie come here to shake them down for money?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: I don’t this this was a straight up shake down. I overheard Eddie say he was doing this for some girl that used to work here. Waitress.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What girl?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Aida. You think she killed Eddie?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, all we know is that the Saldana brothers alibied out. And clearly she’s wrapped up in all of this.

utterance.speaker: AIDA
utterance.content: Why am I here? I have done no wrong.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We just have a few questions about Eddie Ramirez.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Look, Aida, we know about the robbery at the Saldana club.

utterance.speaker: AIDA
utterance.content: Eddie saw me crying after class three days ago. I was, um, très … um, very upset because I was fired from Saldana club.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So why were you fired?

utterance.speaker: AIDA
utterance.content: I worked two years there but because I don’t’ have green card Jose and Frankie make me give them thirty percent of my paycheck.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They were extorting you?

utterance.speaker: AIDA
utterance.content: Yes. But from taking ESL class I get self-esteem and I demand my money. That when they fire me. When Eddie heard he was very furious. He say he would stand up to them and get all my money back.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, if that’s the case then why didn’t Eddie give you the money.

utterance.speaker: AIDA
utterance.content: Oh, but Eddie was going to. He call me yesterday morning to say he got ten thousand dollars for me. I just had to wait because he was not coming to class that day.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So why wasn’t Eddie coming to class yesterday?

utterance.speaker: AIDA
utterance.content: He tell me he was helping another student with a problem. A very dangerous problem.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait, Eddie was helping another student from the class? Who?

utterance.speaker: AIDA
utterance.content: Eddie did not say. But uh, when he told me he sound very nervous. Eddie say he uh … uncover a terrible conspiracy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What kind of conspiracy?

utterance.speaker: AIDA
utterance.content: Eddie did not say. And that was the last time I hear from him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Eddie was helping other students in his class then that means –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was the ESL Equalizer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pardon me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Equalizer. From the TV show. And the movie. He’s a highly skilled operative who exacts vigilante justice for innocent people that can’t defend themselves.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, I am familiar with it, Castle. But Robert McCall’s character was a good guy. Eddie is a corrupt cop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or maybe he’s making amends. Atoning for previous sins. Isn’t that what the American dream’s all about? Trying to build a better future?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, all I know is I’m trying to build a better case right now and if Eddie was helping one of his fellow students with a dangerous problem, then –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That might be what got him killed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And this is Achmed Sayed. He emigrated to this country from Pakistan two years ago. He was a radar systems engineer in the military.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Achmed? Wow. And what does he do now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He runs a hot dog cart in Chelsea.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This is Kim Hyun Joo from Korea. She’s over here on an au pair visa for six months.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And this is Ernie Gonzalez, originally from Bogota. Now this guy was a lawyer. Now he’s temping as a delivery driver for Ronnie’s Chicken Hut.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about Diego?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Diego Lopez from Mexico City. He works at an elementary school as a janitor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what did he do back home?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Worked at an elementary school as a janitor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: These people all emigrated to this country in search of a better life. It looks like Eddie was trying to help them achieve that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Question is, how do we figure out who else Eddie was helping?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, tonight is international food night. And since Jean Luc is a chef I will be plying them with French delicacies.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You packing poutine?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Javier, I’ll have you know that French Canadians are proud descendants of Parisian culture. No, I’ll be serving them pastries from La Bernadine restaurant.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, Castle, that’s one of the premiere French restaurants in the world. They don’t do takeout.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perhaps not for Jean Luc de la Croix, but they will for Monsieur Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry about that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Salut, mes amis.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: Oh, those look good. You said the police were questioning you?

utterance.speaker: AIDA
utterance.content: Yes, they want to hear how Eddie was helping me. But I don’t think it was what got him killed.

utterance.speaker: ALISTAIR
utterance.content: No, the Duncan himself did.

utterance.speaker: AIDA
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: ACHMED
utterance.content: Did the police have any information about the case?

utterance.speaker: AIDA
utterance.content: They did not tell me more. Did Eddie ever say anything to you?

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: No, nothing.

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: Will you eat my gugsu?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, uh … Of course.

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: Jean Luc? What’s wrong? You don’t like it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, um … it’s fantastique. Where did you say this dish was from? I think I’ve had it somewhere before.

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: I doubt that’s true. It’s a family recipe from my village.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Very nice. Um … excusez- moi.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Achmed, are you all right? You seem upset. Do you know who else Eddie was helping?

utterance.speaker: ACHMED
utterance.content: Yes. Me. I – I came to him with problem.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was the problem?

utterance.speaker: ACHMED
utterance.content: A girl in my building is missing. She’s, uh … undocumented. Before she disappeared she tell me someone was forcing her to pay money or else.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you told Eddie this?

utterance.speaker: ACHMED
utterance.content: Yes. He promised to find her. I – I ask about this the day he die and Eddie say it was all more dangerous than he thought. Eddie say he discovered a terrible conspiracy. And now he’s dead. All because of me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, Achmed, it is not your fault. But perhaps I can help. What is this girl’s name?

utterance.speaker: ACHMED
utterance.content: Anita Rodriguez.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I looked into our missing neighbor, Anita Rodriguez. Now, because she’s undocumented there’s next to no public record of her. But I did find out that she was working at a cleaning company off the books. Now, a week and a half ago she missed her shift and hasn’t been … seen … since.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Uh … something weird happened at ESL class today.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, so we just got back from Anita Rodriguez’s apartment. We got a hit on a print.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Marco Sutter?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, he’s an enforcer from up in the Corona neighborhood. Organized crime has a file on this guy. Extortion, money laundering, assault with intent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, go pick him up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Marco Sutter? NYPD.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hold it right there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Gun!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Go, go, go!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD! Let me see your hands up right now!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Put them out the window, now!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here’s what I think. You tried to extort a powerless immigrant and when she couldn’t pay you killed her. And when Eddie came looking for her you killed him, too.

utterance.speaker: MARCO
utterance.content: I want a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Marco lawyered up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But check this out. We found something interesting tucked inside his wallet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We tacked it to a locker out of the GW Bridge bus station.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I doubt Marco’s keeping his laundry there. Could be evidence we can use as leverage.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ll look into it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What a day.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tell me about it. A pit of snakes, getting shot at.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thank God it’s almost over. I don’t think that I could take any more excitement.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: Do you know how long the FBI’s been on this case? Two years! Before Crockett and Tubbs here T-boned my stakeout.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detectives Ryan and Esposito are investigating a homicide, Agent Napier. And no FBI alert came across my desk about your precious little stakeout so why don’t you drop the attitude?

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: How’d you find that locker?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our murder suspect had a key on him when we arrested him.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: And this suspect, does he have a name?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Not until you tell me what’s going on.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: I’m not at liberty to discuss the specifics of my case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Then I guess we’re done here.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: It’s Marco Sutter, isn’t it? It’s the only logical person to have a key. You need to let him go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Screw that. He shot at us.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: I don’t care.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well you should, because if we let him go after that he’s going to figure out why pretty fast.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m guessing Marco’s the low man on your totem pole and you’re tracking the money from his shakedown operations to get to your real target. So why don’t you let us in on the investigation. We can work this together.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: Mmm, that’s not in my playbook, but you’re right. Marco is small potatoes, so you go ahead and keep him. You just remember, my federal case trumps your homicide. So steer clear.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you going to let that pretty boy steamroll us?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. If Marco killed Eddie then we are going to take him down, along with anyone connected to him. But we have to tread lightly, so I’m going to reach out to my guys in the FBI and see if they can tell us what Napier’s up to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Where’s your passport? We’ve got to go to Korea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because I’ve finally figured it out. My missing time? Now it all makes sense. Well, it mostly makes sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute, is this about what happened in your classroom?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I ate a dish today, it triggered a memory. I was in Korea, surrounded by locals, and I could see that temple.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tongdosa Temple?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s in the South Gyeongsang Province.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well we know that you were in Thailand, so Korea’s not a stretch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I must have gone there right after.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have no idea. I – I ordered more food in hopes of jogging another memory. Didn’t work, but that’s okay. When we get to Korea all the food is –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no, no, Castle, I’m not going to Korea.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. You’re right I should go first, that way –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And neither are you. We don’t have enough information yet. It’s too dangerous. You almost got killed in Thailand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Yes, you're right. I’ll just try to keep triggering more memories loose. Are you in the mood for some kimchi? Because I bought, like, four hundred dollars’ worth and – – that stuff goes right through me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So so far there’s no physical evidence linking Marco to Eddie’s murder. Do you have any insight from your federal contacts?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only that Agent Napier specializes in fraud and financial crimes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well since when does financial crimes trump homicide?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Never, as far as I’m concerned.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Who is the sexiest digital investigator alive?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There is no way I’m saying you, bro.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, what’ve you got?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Anita Rodriguez. And she’s alive.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: She’s in Texas being held in a private detention center awaiting deportation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank God she’s alright.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: How on Earth did you find her? There must be hundreds of Anita Rodríguezes out there.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Her fingerprints. And the paper trail for how she ended up at the facility is pretty thin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Intentionally so?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Maybe. But there was one name I could track. Judge Jason Caldwell. He signed the deportation order and from his record there is nothing he likes in this world more than deporting foreigners.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That doesn’t prove that he had anything to do with Eddie’s murder.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: No, but this is pretty damn incriminating. The day before the murder our victim got into a shoving match with Judge Caldwell at the courthouse.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Eddie must have connected the judge to Marco’s extortion scheme and gone down there to confront him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Eddie threatened to expose the criminal conspiracy the judge would have a strong motive to kill him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t get it. The financial upside to extorting immigrants cannot be that high. Why would a judge who makes six figures a year get involved?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: My assumption is Marco kept the extortion money for himself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What would the judge get out of it?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Huge kickbacks from a private prison in Texas. According to Judge Caldwell’s financials he’s got a sweetheart deal with a company that runs a detention center in El Paso. He literally gets paid for every bed that he fills.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: So Marco shakes down the immigrants for money. Sooner or later they run out of cash and then Caldwell ships them to Texas.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And gets paid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I hate this guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Me too. Let’s bring him in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, wait, you guys, he’s a federal judge. We can’t just go after him. If we’re wrong then we’ll … … wait, go full on the security cam.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Guys, look at the janitor. He’s wearing an earpiece.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Why would a janitor need an earpiece?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So is the guy on the bench with the newspaper.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means it’s an FBI surveillance team following the judge.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He must be the FBI’s real target.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ugh, we can’t go at this guy. Not with the Feds watching. Napier clearly stated that we were not to step on his investigation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The NYPD can’t. But I can. With a little help from my friends.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: Caldwell’s on the move, heading to the courthouse.

utterance.speaker: ACHMED
utterance.content: I’m so sorry! A thousand pardons!

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: Get out of the way.

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: Your baby’s so adorable!

utterance.speaker: AIDA
utterance.content: So is yours!

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: Team two, subject is coming your way.

utterance.speaker: FBI AGENT
utterance.content: Can’t help you.

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: Service elevator down the hall.

utterance.speaker: CALDWELL
utterance.content: Oh. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: Hey. Did the Judge go up in the elevator?

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: No entiendo.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: Damn it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After you.

utterance.speaker: CALDWELL
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CALDWELL
utterance.content: This can’t be right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’s the service elevator?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You killed my fiancé.

utterance.speaker: CALDWELL
utterance.content: Hold on, I don’t know what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You are Judge Caldwell. You murdered my fiancé Eddie Ramirez.

utterance.speaker: CALDWELL
utterance.content: I have no idea who that is.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Stop telling lies! I know you are the one who did it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lady, listen, you don’t want to do this, all right? He’s not worth it.

utterance.speaker: CALDWELL
utterance.content: Oh – okay! I did know him. But I promise, I didn’t kill him. I didn’t have to.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: What do you mean, you didn’t have to?

utterance.speaker: CALDWELL
utterance.content: The guy was a cop. He had enemies. And the enemies of my enemies are –

utterance.speaker: CALDWELL
utterance.content: What is this, some kind of a setup? Who the hell are you people?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You – you had better tell me what happened or I’m going to shoot you!

utterance.speaker: CALDWELL
utterance.content: The hell you will.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just let him go. Damn it, we were so close.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The enemy of enemy … is my friend. Do you think the judge dropped a dime to one of Eddie’s enemies back in El Salvador?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Question is, how did the judge find out the names of Eddie’s enemies back in El Salvador?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but Castle said that the judge referenced Eddie’s past as a cop. Why don’t you guys see if you can find out who had a beef with Eddie back in his home country.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: Captain Beckett. Do you have any idea what you’ve done?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I have a feeling you’re about to tell me.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: We lose eyes on Judge Caldwell for all of ten minutes and the next thing you know he’s canceled court and he’s holed up with his lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, who is this judge exactly?

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: Knock it off, Captain. We know you were on to Caldwell this morning. We pulled surveillance video from the courthouse. Your husband and his band of immigrant misfits are all over the footage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, then I will make sure my guys question him.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: Well you better move fast. Because I plan on having each and every one of them deported for this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, you want to go after someone you go after me. But leave those people alone.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: They interfered with a federal investigation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Their friend was murdered. They wanted justice, which includes the ability to live and work in this country without being victimized by a government appointed judge or a power-hungry FBI agent. Eddie’s killer was solicited by Judge Caldwell, which means he’s complicit in the murder. So you help me identify his killer and we will put the good judge away in federal prison for the rest of his life.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: Meet Alonzo Sanchez, foot solider for the Sinaloa drug cartel based out of San Miguel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s his connection to your case?

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: Judge Caldwell expedited his visa forty eight hours ago. We weren’t sure why until you mentioned Eddie Ramirez. Turns out that they had history. Eddie killed Alonzo’s brother, Mario, back when he was cop in El Salvador.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The enemy of my enemy is my friend. This must be who Judge Caldwell was talking about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Alonzo was out for revenge against Eddie and the judge was all too happy to help.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks. Alonzo Sanchez landed at JFK four hours before Eddie was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, sounds like we have our killer. Now we just have to track him down before he goes back home.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We might be too late for that. He boarded a flight fifteen minutes ago. He’s already in the air.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well then we’re done. There’s no way we can get him now.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: No, you can’t. But I can. This is Agent Napier. I need to turn a plane around.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s too back your plane got rerouted, Alonzo. On the bright side, I spoke to the airline and you’re still going to get the miles.

utterance.speaker: ALONZO SANCHEZ
utterance.content: You’ve got nothing on me. I was here legally.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: Well what was the purpose of the trip?

utterance.speaker: ALONZO
utterance.content: Visiting an old friend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Visiting? Or feeding him to the snakes.

utterance.speaker: ALONZO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: Come on, Alonzo. Drop the act. We know you came here for Eddie Ramirez. He killed your brother. And Judge Caldwell, he greased the wheels to get you up here.

utterance.speaker: ALONZO
utterance.content: Judge who? I don’t know what you’re talking about, man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We tracked down the cab driver who picked you up from the airport and took you to the zoo. We know you killed Eddie.

utterance.speaker: ALONZO
utterance.content: Eddie is dead? That wasn’t me. Okay. The judge reached out to me, and yes, I went to the zoo to see Eddie but I did not kill him.

utterance.speaker: AGENT NAPIER
utterance.content: So what’d you come up here for, then? A friendly chat? Maybe a frozen hot chocolate at Serendipity?

utterance.speaker: ALONZO
utterance.content: I came here with revenge in my heart. I thought that Eddie was responsible for my brother’s death. But I was wrong. Eddie convinced me that he had been working with my brother in secret. Protecting him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Eddie would tell you anything if he thought you were going to kill him. So what made you believe him?

utterance.speaker: ALONZO
utterance.content: Eddie knew things about Mario that only someone close to my brother would know. And his attitude wasn’t that of a man lying to save his life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean by that?

utterance.speaker: ALONZO
utterance.content: Eddie hated the man that he was back in El Salvador. What he did to protect my brother weighed on him. He told me that he despised everything my family stands for. What he used to stand for. That’s why he came to America. To start over, build a new life. Here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And he did. Until somebody took it away from him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: Oh. So Alonzo alibied out. Looks like we were wrong about Judge Caldwell’s involvement.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. We’re missing something. Eddie confronted the judge and the next day he was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we know it wasn’t the judge. He was under twenty four hour surveillance. And besides, he thought that Alonzo was going to take care of it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eddie confronts the judge. Twelve hours later Alonzo’s on a plane with an approved visa. How did the judge even know about Alonzo? Who told him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, you’re right. We didn’t even know about Alonzo. How did the judge find out so quickly?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There has to be someone else involved in this conspiracy. Someone close to Eddie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, the only people that are close to him are in ESL class. So who would kill him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I know. And you know what this means, Beckett? After all these years I finally get to say … j’accuse.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: So we’re going to focus in on the verbs. Now, if we had – – Jean Luc, you’re late.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, oui, Monsieur. Pardonne moi.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: That’s all right. Have a seat.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: Actually, Monsieur Emerson, if I could just have a word with … you. In private, sil vous plaît.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: Jean Luc? Did you bring these men here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh yeah, they’re with me. They’re here to arrest you for the murder of Eddie Ramirez.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We know you were working with Judge Caldwell, funneling him immigrants in exchange for a cut of the extortion money.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know each one of their pressure points, which ones were illegal.

utterance.speaker: EMERSON
utterance.content: That’s absurd.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Is it? Then why are so many of your students in those private detention centers? Too many to be a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a solid plan. I mean, who’s going to notice? They’re here alone, marginalized by society. In your position I’d’ve done the same thing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No you wouldn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I wouldn’t. I have a soul.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Come on. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Everyone, I have some good news. Anita Rodriguez has been released. And a federal investigation has been launched into the private detention facility that was holding her.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: ACHMED
utterance.content: What about the judge?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your teacher sold him out. He confessed to everything. Now the FBI can properly prosecute the judge and justice has been served.

utterance.speaker: AIDA
utterance.content: Si magnificent! Oh, but uh … who will finish teaching us now?

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: I saw on the website. It’s Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … I’m – I’m so sorry, I have no idea how that got on there.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I do. Only the Castle that will be filling in isn’t a mister.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice work.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Darling, I am so proud. Isn’t she lovely. Okay, everyone. Shall we dine? Follow me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, yes. And everyone, we are so glad that you are all able to join us. Now, we celebrated your food earlier. We think it’s time for you guys to celebrate some American food.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Voila.

utterance.speaker: ACHMED
utterance.content: This is American food?

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: It’s very … international.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Exactly. And this country was founded by immigrants. And it’s those customs and cultures that have shaped and molded us. And you – and you are the ones that make this country great.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, I couldn’t have said it better myself. Now, let’s dig in.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes. Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There are plates behind you there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wasn’t in Korea. I was in Koreatown. In Los Angeles. Beckett, I’ve got to go to LA.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
